Boston.com
10

Sally Ride, first American woman in space, dies at 61

Ride, who was 32 when she rode on the shuttle Challenger in 1983, died of pancreatic cancer, her office in San Diego said. President Obama called Ride a national hero. (AP)
Offer condolences  |  Notable deaths

Police: Maine man took gun to 'Batman', was on way to shoot former employer

Timothy Courtois, who was stopped for allegedly speeding, told authorities he had attended "The Dark Knight Rises" movie on Saturday in Saco with a loaded gun in his backpack, Maine state police said. (Boston Globe)

Lawyer for suspect's family: Hearts go out to victims

James Holmes's family expressed sorrow for victims of the Aurora, Colo., attack, hours after the suspect appeared in court. (AP)
  • Colo. university mum on theater shooting suspect
  • Pictures Suspect in court  |  Colorado begins to heal
  • Pictures The shooting victims  |  Other mass shootings

Atrium Mall sale latest change to Route 9

A Needham-based developer said today it purchased the Atrium Mall at Chestnut Hill and plans to redevelop it.
  • Review the evolution of Route 128

Penn State hit with $60m fine, loss of bowls in wake of child abuse scandal

The NCAA fined Penn State $60 million, ordered a four-year bowl-game suspension and, vacated some of Joe Paterno's wins after a sex scandal. (AP)
  • Survey Agree with sanctions?  |  Discuss  |  Video

Lynn man fatally shot by police

Officials said Brandon Payne was shot by police after the car he was in allegedly hit a police vehicle. Payne was hospitalized and later died, officials said. (Boston Globe)

Why is it Assembly Square?

The Big Picture

Colorado theater shooting

Shock, misery, and anger rose after a shooter went on a rampage at a movie theater in Aurora, Colo., on Friday night. At least 70 people were shot, 12 of them fatally.
